results.title: 11 Killed in Pittsburgh Synagogue Massacre; Suspect Charged With 29 Counts
results.abstract: The suspect in the Saturday morning attack, identified as Robert D. Bowers, 46, was in custody, law enforcement officials said. At least 11 people were reported killed.
results.byline: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON, CHRISTOPHER MELE and SABRINA TAVERNISE

results.title: Used to Hearing ‘Shabbat Shalom,’ a Historic Jewish Enclave Rings Out With Gunshots
results.abstract: Pittsburgh’s Squirrel Hill neighborhood is a close-knit Jewish community. Its day of worship turned into one of mourning after a gunman stormed into a synagogue.

results.title: Cesar Sayoc’s Path on Social Media: From Food Photos to Partisan Fury
results.abstract: By the time he was arrested, Mr. Sayoc appeared to fit a familiar profile of a modern extremist, radicalized online and sucked into a vortex of partisan furor.

results.title: Cesar Sayoc, Mail Bombing Suspect, Found an Identity in Political Rage and Resentment
results.abstract: Mr. Sayoc styled himself as a successful bodybuilder and entrepreneur in South Florida. But court records and people who knew him recalled him differently.
results.byline: By JACK HEALY, JULIE TURKEWITZ and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr.

results.byline: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM, ALAN FEUER and ADAM GOLDMAN

results.title: Red-Hot Economy? Women Aren’t Convinced
results.abstract: A remarkable gender gap, transcending party lines, has opened up in Americans’ views of both their own finances and the broader national economy.
results.byline: By BEN CASSELMAN and JIM TANKERSLEY

multimedia.caption: Kylie Pierce, 38, photographed on Tuesday, Oct. 23, 2018, in IIion, NY. Pierce works as a grant writer for a couple local nonprofits. She once owned a home with her ex-husband, but now rents. She feels like the economy isn’t working for people in her generation or her part of the country.

results.title: Stephen Hawking’s Final Paper: How to Escape From a Black Hole
results.abstract: In a study from beyond the grave, the theoretical physicist sings (mathematically) of memory, loss and the possibility of data redemption.

multimedia.caption: In his posthumously published, last scientific paper, Stephen Hawking theorized that information may yet be able to elude a black hole by becoming encoded on its surface in the form of “soft hair.”

results.title: Scientists Catch Rare Glimpses of the Endangered Vaquita
results.abstract: An expedition in the Gulf of California yielded photographs and video of a species nearing extinction.

multimedia.caption: An extremely rare glimpse of vaquitas, an endangered porpoise that lives only in the Gulf of California, taken last month. Scientists estimate only 30 vaquitas remain.
multimedia.copyright: Oscar Ortiz/Museo de la Ballena y Ciencias del Mar

results.title: Pando, the Most Massive Organism on Earth, Is Shrinking
results.abstract: The grove of 47,000 quivering aspen trees in Utah is being diminished by mule deer, foraging cattle and human mismanagement.

multimedia.caption: Pando is a forest of one.

results.title: Can There Really Be Two Moms?
results.abstract: A lesbian mother grapples with the pain of a child favoring the mother who gave birth to her.

multimedia.caption: The author with her wife, Sabrina Weiss, and their daughter, Marty, near their Brooklyn home last weekend.
